qas.question: When did the era of planning start in Himachal Pradesh?
What kind of plan was it?
Where does Himachal Pradesh rank in per capita?
What was more than 50% used on?
When did the era of road construction start in India?
How much was allocated for developing far away areas?
How much of the expense was for the planning process?
Where does India rank regarding per capita income?

plausible_answers.text: the process of planning and development could not be carried to the people

qas.question: What would happen without a proper five-year plan?

context: The era of planning in Himachal Pradesh started <a0_0><b5_0>1948<b5_0/><a0_0/> along with the rest of India. The first <a2_0>five-year plan<a2_0/> allocated <a1_0><b6_0>₹ 52.7 million<b6_0/><a1_0/> to Himachal. More than <b7_0>50% of this expenditure<b7_0/> was incurred on <a4_0>road construction<a4_0/> since it was felt that without proper transport facilities, <b9_0>the process of planning and development could not be carried to the people<b9_0/>, who mostly lived an isolated existence in far away areas. Himachal now ranks <a3_0><b8_0>fourth<b8_0/><a3_0/> in respect of per capita income among the states of the Indian Union.
